note_text:
Indication: Lung-RADS 4X nodule (22mm RUL).
Procedure: Bronchoscopy with Galaxy robotic navigation.
- Navigated to RUL (RB3). Reg error 3.6mm.
- TiLT+ used to correct 1.4cm divergence.
- rEBUS: Eccentric view.
- TBNA (22G) x 6 passes.
- BAL RUL: 60cc in/22cc out.
- Fiducial placed.
ROSE: Benign respiratory epithelium.
Plan: Recovery, D/C.

registry_entry.institution_name: Sharp Memorial Hospital, San Diego, CA
registry_entry.ebus_rose_result: Benign respiratory epithelium and macrophages

changes: Populated billing object with 2025 Facility RVUs

note_text: The patient presented for diagnostic bronchoscopy regarding a 22mm RUL lesion. Following induction of general anesthesia, the Noah Galaxy robotic system was deployed. Electromagnetic registration was achieved with 3.6mm accuracy. Upon navigation to the RB3 segment, Augmented Fluoroscopy (TiLT+) identified a significant divergence of 1.4cm necessitating alignment correction. Once confirmed via eccentric rEBUS signal, sampling was performed using a 22G needle and bronchoalveolar lavage. A gold fiducial was implanted for future stereotactic planning. Cytopathology revealed benign cells.

note_text:

31627: Navigation (Galaxy system utilized to reach RUL target).
31654: Radial EBUS (Peripheral probe used to localize 22mm lesion).
31629: TBNA (22G needle aspiration of RUL nodule).
31626: Fiducial Markers (Placement of gold marker for SBRT).
31624: BAL (Separate lavage of target segment).
Technique: TiLT+ tomosynthesis used to verify tool-in-lesion.

note_text: The patient underwent elective robotic bronchoscopy for a suspicious 14mm nodule in the Right Middle Lobe. The Noah Galaxy platform was utilized. Intra-procedural tomosynthesis (TiLT+) revealed a 2.1cm target divergence attributed to respiratory motion, which was digitally corrected. Following concentric rEBUS confirmation, transbronchial needle aspiration was executed. Rapid on-site evaluation suggested necrosis with atypia.
